optimized.resolution.algorithm

Class ConflictResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • optimized.resolution.algorithm.ConflictResolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Resolver

    public class ConflictResolver
extends java.lang.Object
implements Resolver

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConflictResolver(Rules rules, Anomalies anomalies) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      RemovedEntries executeSolveRequest(SolveRequest solveRequest)
      This function solve the conflict anomalies by performing the commands sent by the network administrator by filling xml file that satisfy the schemas defined in the folder XSD.
      java.util.List<AnomalyType> getConflictAnomalies()
      This function return all the anomalies of the following types (AnomalyNames.CONTRADICTION,AnomalyNames.SHADOWING_CONFLICT, AnomalyNames.CORRELATION) in a list so that the administrator can check this list and reply with a possible solution for these anomalies
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      RemovedEntries removeDuplicationOrShadowingRedundancyAnomaly(AnomalyNames anomalyName)
      This function removes the Duplicated rules and the anomalies caused by these rules or rules causing shadowing redundancy anomaly
      RemovedEntries removeIrrelevanceAnomaly()
      This function removes the irrelevant rules and the anomalies caused by these rules This function doesn't receive any arguments as the need arguments are provided in the constructor of the main class(conflictResolver)
      void resolveAnomalies()
      This Method doesn't return anything it performs the first 3 anomaly types i.e {Irrelevant,Duplicate,Shadowing Redundancy} This method uses the other two methods removeIrrelevanceAnomaly(),removeDuplicationOrShadowingRedundancyAnomaly(AnomalyNames anomalyName) so If you used this function you don't have to use the two previously mentioned methods

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • resolveAnomalies

        public void resolveAnomalies()
        Description copied from interface: Resolver
        This Method doesn't return anything it performs the first 3 anomaly types i.e {Irrelevant,Duplicate,Shadowing Redundancy} This method uses the other two methods removeIrrelevanceAnomaly(),removeDuplicationOrShadowingRedundancyAnomaly(AnomalyNames anomalyName) so If you used this function you don't have to use the two previously mentioned methods
        Specified by:
        resolveAnomalies in interface Resolver

      • removeIrrelevanceAnomaly

        public RemovedEntries removeIrrelevanceAnomaly()
        Description copied from interface: Resolver
        This function removes the irrelevant rules and the anomalies caused by these rules This function doesn't receive any arguments as the need arguments are provided in the constructor of the main class(conflictResolver)
        Specified by:
        removeIrrelevanceAnomaly in interface Resolver
        Returns:
        an object of type RemovedEntries which contains 2 sets i.e {setremovedRules,setremovedAnomalies} which contains all the anomalies and rules removed by this function.

      • removeDuplicationOrShadowingRedundancyAnomaly

        public RemovedEntries removeDuplicationOrShadowingRedundancyAnomaly(AnomalyNames anomalyName)
        Description copied from interface: Resolver
        This function removes the Duplicated rules and the anomalies caused by these rules or rules causing shadowing redundancy anomaly
        Specified by:
        removeDuplicationOrShadowingRedundancyAnomaly in interface Resolver
        Parameters:
        anomalyName - this parameter is used to specify which operation you want to do either(AnomalyNames.DUPLICATION or AnomalyNames.SHADOWING_REDUNDANCY)
        Returns:
        an object of type RemovedEntries which contains 2 sets i.e {setremovedRules,setremovedAnomalies} which contains all the anomalies and rules removed by this function.

      • getConflictAnomalies

        public java.util.List<AnomalyType> getConflictAnomalies()
        Description copied from interface: Resolver
        This function return all the anomalies of the following types (AnomalyNames.CONTRADICTION,AnomalyNames.SHADOWING_CONFLICT, AnomalyNames.CORRELATION) in a list so that the administrator can check this list and reply with a possible solution for these anomalies
        Specified by:
        getConflictAnomalies in interface Resolver
        Returns:
        List of all the conflict anomalies in the rules provided

      • executeSolveRequest

        public RemovedEntries executeSolveRequest(SolveRequest solveRequest)
        Description copied from interface: Resolver
        This function solve the conflict anomalies by performing the commands sent by the network administrator by filling xml file that satisfy the schemas defined in the folder XSD.
        Specified by:
        executeSolveRequest in interface Resolver
        Parameters:
        solveRequest - Contain three list each on of them contains the solution corresponding to the three conflict anomaly types.
        Returns:
        an object of type RemovedEntries which contains 2 sets i.e {setremovedRules,setremovedAnomalies} which contains all the anomalies and rules removed by this function.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
